Comment.Language: Commonly known as the Prayer of the Basin.

This an optional prayer for those who wish to rejoice for the childâ€™s birth. On the seventh day after the birth and before the baptism, water is poured into a basin (washtub) with a little salt and a little oil, and seven candles lit around it.

Text.Language: O God, the Great, the Eternal, the Lord, the Pantocrator, through Your Logos, our Lord Jesus Christ, THE BEING from the beginning and forever,
Vnou] pinis] pisae~neh P[oic Pipantokratwr v/e~te e~bol hitotf m~f/e~te vwk n~logoc Pen[oic I/couc Pi,~rictoc: v/etsop icjen h/ nem sa e~neh.

You have created the world in Your unsearchable wisdom. You created man after Your own image and Your likeness.
Ouoh menenca y~rekyamio m~pikocmoc qen tekcovia n~ataur/jc: akyamio m~pirwmi kata y/e~te ywk n~hikwn nem kata peki~ni.

You have filled him with the mercy of Your goodness and have adorned him with all splendor. You have given him a spirit of wisdom and rational understanding and gave him authority over all things. You have appointed him to work all day that he may bless You.

Akmahf e~bol qen v~nai n~tekmeta~gahoc: akcelcwlf e~bol qen metcaie niben: ak] naf n~oup~neuma n~covia nem ouka] n~no/~ton ak] ersisi naf e~jen en,ai niben: ak,af e~erhwb m~pie~hoou t/rf: ouoh je n~tefc~mou e~rok.

Therefore, we ask and entreat Your goodness for Your servant (...) the son/daughter of (...) and (...), bless him/her with all heavenly blessings. Bless also, O Lord, his/her birth. May his/her days be lengthened according to Your grace.

Eybe vai ten]ho ouoh tentwbh m~mok pia~gayooc hijen pekbwk (nim) p~s/ri pa (nim) nem ya (nim). Cmou e~rof qen c~mou niben n~e~poranion: c~mou e~perjinmici on P[oic: marefjem a~hi kata v/e~te vwk n~h~mot.

Let him/her grow and increase a hundred fold and sixty fold and thirty fold.

Comment.Language: Then the priest signs the water and says:
Then he bathes the child with the water while the people sing:
